description: Data was extracted from the TCGA program in June 2016. Each row contains a TCGA patient record. More details: see https://www.cancer.gov/about-nci/organization/ccg/research/structural-genomics/tcga

fields.description: TCGA barcode identifier for the study participant, eg TCGA-02-0001
fields.name: ParticipantBarcode

fields.description: TCGA study abbreviation, eg LAML. Full list available at https://gdc.cancer.gov/resources-TCGA-users/TCGA-code-tables/TCGA-study-abbreviations
fields.name: Study

fields.description: The project value is always set to TCGA.
fields.name: Project

fields.description: A UUID (Universal Unique Identifier) is a 128-bit number used to uniquely identify an object or entity in the TCGA system. Example: 31ac4afd-8195-479a-97da-92edaa89a85e. See https://docs.gdc.cancer.gov/Encyclopedia/pages/UUID/
fields.name: ParticipantUUID

fields.description: Tissue Source Site Code. Examples: CN, DQ, F7. See https://gdc.cancer.gov/resources-TCGA-users/TCGA-code-tables/tissue-source-site-codes for explanation of codes
fields.name: TSSCode

fields.description: Age, in years, at which a condition or disease was first diagnosed
fields.name: age_at_initial_pathologic_diagnosis

fields.description: The spatial location, subdivisions and/or atomic site name of a tumor; e.g. Rectum, Larynx, Tonsil, etc.
fields.name: anatomic_neoplasm_subdivision

fields.description: The BCR Batch Code; see https://gdc.cancer.gov/resources-TCGA-users/TCGA-code-tables/bcr-batch-codes for explanation of the codes
fields.name: batch_number

fields.description: Biospecimen Core Resource; e.g. Nationwide Children's Hospital, Washington University
fields.name: bcr

fields.description: The clinical M score is a rating of metastasis, that is, how much cancer has spread to distant sites. It is based on results of tests done before surgery, such as physical exams and imaging scans; e.g. MX, M0, M1
fields.name: clinical_M

fields.description: The clinical N score is a rating of the extent of cancer within nearby lymph nodes, based on results of tests done before surgery, such as physical exams and imaging scans; e.g. N1, N2, N3
fields.name: clinical_N

fields.description: The clinical T score is a rating of the extent of the primary tumor, based on results of tests done before surgery, such as physical exams and imaging scans; e.g. T1, T2, T3, T4
fields.name: clinical_T

fields.description: The stage of the cancer, based on results of tests done before surgery, such as physical exams and imaging scans; e.g. Stage IA, Stage 1B, Stage II, Stage III, Stage IIIC2, Stage IVA , State IVB
fields.name: clinical_stage

fields.description: Indicates whether the participant has colorectal cancer; e.g. YES, NO
fields.name: colorectal_cancer

fields.description: Country of the participant; 38 countries named,e.g. Germany, United States, Canada,France, Poland, etc.
fields.name: country

fields.description: Survival state of the participant; e.g. dead, alive
fields.name: vital_status

fields.description: Days since birth (a negative value, relative to the date of diagnosis which is considered to be t=0)
fields.name: days_to_birth

fields.description: If vital_status indicates 'dead', then this is the number of days to death (a positive value) relative to the date of diagnosis.
fields.name: days_to_death

fields.description: Number of days from the date of diagnosis to the last day on which a person was known to be alive. This field is a combination of the days_to_last_followup and days_to death fields. Therefore, this field can be used whether the vital_status is 'alive' or 'dead'.
fields.name: days_to_last_known_alive

fields.description: If vital_status indicates 'alive', then this is the number of days from the date of diagnosis to the last followup (communication contact).
fields.name: days_to_last_followup

fields.description: The number of days to initial pathologic diagnosis
fields.name: days_to_initial_pathologic_diagnosis

fields.description: Numeric value to represent the day of the diagnosis for the submitted sample. Examples: 0, 4, 536, 3774
fields.name: days_to_submitted_specimen_dx

fields.description: The ethnic origination of a participant, independent from race; e.g. Not Hispanic or Latino, Hispanic or Latino
fields.name: ethnicity

fields.description: Participant gender; e.g. Male, Female
fields.name: gender

fields.description: The Gleason Score (ranging from 1 -5) is the grade of the aggressiveness of prostate cancer. The combined Gleason Score is the primary Gleason score(for the largest area of the tumor) added to the secondary Gleason Score (for the next largest section of the tumor).Five values used: 6.0, 7.0, 8.0, 9.0, 10.0
fields.name: gleason_score_combined

fields.description: The histological type of cancer; e.g. Adenosquamous, Astrocytoma, etc.
fields.name: histological_type

fields.description: Indicator if the participant had a previous history of colon polyps as noted in the history/physical or previous endoscopic report(s); e.g. YES, NO
fields.name: history_of_colon_polyps

fields.description: History_of_neoadjuvant_treatment. Possible values: Yes, No,Yes - Pharmaceutical Treatmet Prior to Resection, Yes - Radiation Prior to Resection(also can be blank)
fields.name: history_of_neoadjuvant_treatment

fields.description: HPV strains; e.g. HPV18, HPV45, etc.
fields.name: hpv_calls

fields.description: Indicates whether the participant has a record of a positive finding for human papillomavirus; e.g. Positive, Negative, Indeterminate
fields.name: hpv_status

fields.description: Alphanumeric value used to describe the disease code from the tenth version of the International Classification of Disease (ICD-10). Examples: C01, C55, C40.3
fields.name: icd_10

fields.description: Code that represents the histology of the disease using the third edition of the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, published in 2000, used principally in tumor and cancer registries for coding the site (topography) and the histology (morphology) of neoplasms
fields.name: icd_o_3_histology

fields.description: Code that represents the site of the disease using the third edition of the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, published in 2000, used principally in tumor and cancer registries for coding the site (topography) and the histology (morphology) of neoplasms. Examples:C01.9, C20.9, C32.1
fields.name: icd_o_3_site

fields.description: Indicator if small or thin-walled vessel invasion is present, indicating lymphatic involvement; e.g. YES, NO
fields.name: lymphatic_invasion

fields.description: Indicator whether the lymph nodes were examined; e.g. YES, NO
fields.name: lymphnodes_examined

fields.description: Indicator whether a lymphovascular invasion was present; e.g. YES, NO
fields.name: lymphovascular_invasion_present

fields.description: A female participant's menopausal status; e.g. Post, Pre, Indeterminate, Peri
fields.name: menopause_status

fields.description: Status of the mononucleotide and dinucleotide marker panel analysis; microsatellite-stable (MSS), low level MSI (MSI-L) if less than 40% of markers were altered and high level MSI (MSI-H) if greater than 40% of markers were altered
fields.name: mononucleotide_and_dinucleotide_marker_panel_analysis_status

fields.description: Rating which expresses the degree of abnormality of cancer cells, a measure of differentiation and aggressiveness; e.g. G1, G2, G3, G4, GX, High Grage, GB, Low Grade
fields.name: neoplasm_histologic_grade

fields.description: Indicates whether a patient has had a new tumor event after initial treatment; Yes, No
fields.name: new_tumor_event_after_initial_treatment

fields.description: The number of lymph nodes examined. Examples: 90.0, 33.0, 2.0, 62.0, 109.0
fields.name: number_of_lymphnodes_examined

fields.description: The number of lymph nodes involved with disease as determined by histological examination. Examples: 34.0, 97.0, 1.0, 2.0, 12.0, 44.0
fields.name: number_of_lymphnodes_positive_by_he

fields.description: The number of packs smoked per day times the number of years smoked by the participant. Examples: 5.1, 1.5, 180.0, 30.0, 15.0
fields.name: number_pack_years_smoked

fields.description: Four digit year of the initial pathologic diagnosis
fields.name: year_of_initial_pathologic_diagnosis

fields.description: The pathologic M score is a rating of metastasis, that is, how much cancer has spread to distant sites. It is based on surgery or biopsy; e.g. MX, M0, M1, M1a, M1b, M1c, cM0(i+)
fields.name: pathologic_M

fields.description: The pathologic N score is a rating of the extent of cancer within nearby lymph nodes, based on surgery or biopsy; e.g. N0, N1, N2, N2b, N2c, N1b, NX
fields.name: pathologic_N

fields.description: The pathologic T score is a rating of the extent of the primary tumor, based on surgery or biopsy; e.g. T1, T2, T3, T4, T4a, T4b, TX
fields.name: pathologic_T

fields.description: The stage of the cancer, based on surgery or biopsy; e.g. Stage II, Stage III, Stage IV, Stage IVA, Stage IIIB, Stage IIIS, Stage IIIC
fields.name: pathologic_stage

fields.description: The participant's cancer status; Either WITH TUMOR or TUMOR FREE
fields.name: person_neoplasm_cancer_status

fields.description: The number of times (including currently if it applies) that a female participant has been pregnant, regardless of outcome. Possible values: 0, 1, 2, 3, 4+
fields.name: pregnancies

fields.description: Indicates whether a person had a primary diagnosis of melanoma; e.g. Yes, No
fields.name: primary_neoplasm_melanoma_dx

fields.description: Kind of outcome achieved after the completion of the initial course of treatment; e.g. Complete Remission/Response, Progressive Disease, Stable Disease, Partial Remission/Response, Persistent Diseaase, etc.
fields.name: primary_therapy_outcome_success

fields.description: A male participant's Prostrate-Specific Antigen (PSA) value. Examples: 0.1, 3.5, 37.36
fields.name: psa_value

fields.description: The race of a participant, independent from ethnicity; e.g. White, Black or African American, Asian, Native Hawaiian or other Pacific Islander, American Indian or Alaska Native
fields.name: race

fields.description: Status of the tissue margin following surgical resection. There are 4 possible values: R0, R1, R2, RX
fields.name: residual_tumor

fields.description: Category describing current smoking status and smoking history as self-reported by a participant.; Possible values: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5
fields.name: tobacco_smoking_history

fields.description: Category describing current smoking status and smoking history as self-reported by a participant.; e.g. 1, 2, etc.
fields.name: tumor_tissue_site

fields.description: Tumor Type. There are 3 allowed values:Primary, Type 1, Type 2
fields.name: tumor_type

fields.description: Weight of participant in kilograms
fields.name: weight

fields.description: Height of participant in centimeters. Examples:172.0, 180.0
fields.name: height

fields.description: Body Mass Index (BMI) of participant
fields.name: BMI

fields.description: Age, in years, that the participant began smoking
fields.name: age_began_smoking_in_years

fields.description: Indicator of previous or current diagnosis of Helicobactor pylori infection; e.g. Yes, No, Never, Current
fields.name: h_pylori_infection

fields.description: Indicator and type of other diagnosis; e.g. No; Yes, History of Prior Malignancy; Yes, History of Synchronous/Bilateral Malignancy; Both History of Synchronous/Bilateral and Prior Malignancy
fields.name: other_dx

fields.description: The site on the body where the other malignancy occurred; e.g. Bladder, Uterus, etc.
fields.name: other_malignancy_anatomic_site

fields.description: The histological type of cancer of the other malignancy; e.g. Adenosquamous, Astrocytoma, etc.
fields.name: other_malignancy_histological_type

fields.description: Indicates whether another malignancy occurred before or at the same time; e.g. Prior Malignancy, Synchronous Malignancy, etc.
fields.name: other_malignancy_malignancy_type

fields.description: Four-digit year that the participant stopped smoking; e.g. 2010
fields.name: stopped_smoking_year

fields.description: Indicator as to whether a large vessel or venous invasion was detected by surgery or presence in a tumor specimen; e.g. Yes, No
fields.name: venous_invasion

fields.description: Four-digit year that the participant started smoking; e.g. 2010
fields.name: year_of_tobacco_smoking_onset
